title: adobe acrobat extension add-on
content:
Hi I have installed Adobe Acrobat.

I launch Firefox - click 'Alt' - choose 'Tools' - choose 'Add-ons and themes' - I choose 'Extensions'. Adobe Acrobat is not show anywhere i.e. not under 'Recommended Extensions'.

I have opened Settings - General - Applications and change Portable Document Format (PDF) to 'Use Adobe Acrobat'

Still, Adobe Acrobat doesn't show up as an alternative under 'Extensions'.

Why is this? What am I doing wrong?

Best regards Jan

title: Why still black background? I picked light for layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override + ui.systemUsesDarkTheme
content:
You can see below my choices for - `1` for light, in `layout.css.prefers-color-scheme.content-override` - `0` for light, in `ui.systemUsesDarkTheme`. - "Light" website appearance AND theme().

But why some websites still darken and blacken background ? Examples are https://superuser.com, https://softwarerecs.stackexchange.com.

This mishap DOESN'T happen in Troubleshoot Mode. But I don't have the Dark Reader extension.

Cross-site Backup
creator: StackExchange

title: Sum menus are blank
content:
I am running Firefox on my desktop Windows 10 computer. Lately I have the following problem: 1. When I click on '+ New Message', nothing happens. 2. When I click on any of the top level menu items, such as File, Edit, etc., I get an empty window. No text in the sub menus, just the empty white rectangular window. They seem to have the correct number of rows, but no text appears. Some entries do have a right arrow >. If I follow that, I may get a valid looking sub menu with text, but usually I get another empty window. 3. Same thing if I right click on any of the Inbox listing items.

I have tried to clear the problem by rebooting the computer, but that is as far as I know what to do.

Any suggestions?
creator: colbus100

title: No se ha restaurado el firefox que tenía
content:
Hola, he formateado mi ordenador muchas veces y puesto que siempre tengo mi cuenta de firefox conectada al navegador, tras formatear simplemente introducía mi usuario y contraseña en el navegador de firefox y me volvía todo a como lo tenía antes de formatear (incluso con las pestañas que tenía abiertas).

Ayer volví a formatear, y tras conectar la misma cuenta al navegador firefox, no se me ha restaurado absolutamente NADA, ni marcadores, ni historial, ni pestañas, nada de nada.

Necesito recuperar todo.

Un saludo y gracias.
creator: mistelegramas

title: Cannot access my Pocket data
content:
Hope I'm in the right place. I'm not computer literate. I cannot access my Pocket data. I am asked to log in every time I try. I log in, and get a message that "Something went wrong while retrieving your data." I cleared my cache and history, restarted my computer (Windows 10), made sure private browsing was not checked, and that Pocket was an "allowed" exception. I also tried to submit two support tickets. I got an auto reply saying a confirmation email was sent to my account address each time, but all I got was a notice of a new sign in. I checked my spam file. No confirmation was received. Any assistance would be appreciated. Thank you.

Soretta Rodack
creator: Soretta

creator: max.matter01

title: In New Mail created in Outlook.live.com, no visible border between "To:", "Add a subject" and the email body
content:
Outlook displays the "To:" and "Add a subject" labels in black/grey text, but the rest of the "New Mail" window is white. There are no visible border lines between the "To" line and the "Subject" line. And no visible border between Subject and the email body.

The side-effect is an elderly person writes their entire email into the subject line field because it is not obvious where the email body starts.

I've seen this behavior on 2 different computers running the same (latest 120.0.1) Firefox. Odd thing is that I DO see borders when I run Outlook.com on my work laptop (same Firefox version). What config settings might control behavior like this?

I captured screenshots of the desired display of borders on my laptop. Tried .jpg, .png and .bmp. All of the files showed the borders between To, Subject and email body. But when those files are transferred to the PC I am on, the borders no longer display. Bizarre. I uploaded/download the files using Onedrive to ensure that the corporate email server was not touching the files. Even then the borders that exist in the files on the laptop do not display when those same files are viewed on my home PC.
creator: outback20

title: Firefox performance issues
content:
Hi,

There seems to be many Firefox processes running which consumes large amount of CPU and memory (attached) - I have only opened a single instance of Firefox however there seems to be problems with this. I end Firefox processes and start anew, however it appears the same. I restart the computer and open firefox it appears the same. I'm not sure whats going on. This is impacting my PC performance negatively.
